intro: Sapium bogotense, commonly known as the Bogotá soapberry, is a small evergreen shrub native to the highlands of Colombia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries that contain a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for cultivation in subtropical climates.
